title: Japanese Sentence Completion Quiz - Medium Mode
description: Test your Japanese vocabulary and grammar knowledge by completing sentences. This quiz is designed for intermediate learners.
instructions: Fill in the blank with the correct Japanese word in Romaji.
The case (uppercase or lowercase) of your answer does not matter, as long as the spelling is correct.
After completing all questions, submit your answers for scoring.

items.question: Asa, kohi to _____ wo tabemasu. (In the morning, I eat coffee and bread.)
Kono _____ wa amari takaku arimasen. (This book is not very expensive.)
Watashi wa _____ de Nihongo wo benkyou shimasu. (I study Japanese on my computer.)
Kare wa _____ de kaimono wo suru no ga suki desu. (He likes shopping at the supermarket.)
Watashi no inu wa _____ ga daisuki desu. (My dog loves playing with a ball.)
Kanojo wa _____ ni ikimasu. (She goes to the library.)
Watashitachi wa _____ de eiga wo mimashita. (We watched a movie on TV.)
Watashi wa _____ de Nihon ni ikimasu. (I will go to Japan by plane.)
Kare wa _____ ga totemo jouzu desu. (He is very good at playing the guitar.)
Kono _____ wa watashi no desu. (This camera is mine.)

scoring.10 correct answers: Outstanding! Your grasp of Japanese vocabulary and sentence structure is excellent.
scoring.7-9 correct answers: Very good! You have a strong understanding with minor areas for improvement.
scoring.4-6 correct answers: Good job! You're on the right track, but there's room to grow.
scoring.1-3 correct answers: Fair effort. Keep practicing to enhance your Japanese skills.
scoring.0 correct answers: A tough challenge, but don't give up! Study and practice will help you improve.
